comment.body: Thanks for helping that ZeroNet will work also this way

Nice. You should also make a link to the drawback from github, having read that, I wonder how long it takes to be brute forced (in the end the sites are just locally on my HD, so I assume the author did not build in some rate limit, or 3-tries kind of thing?)

One of the dirs in my data has 31 MB here, so 1.4 MB should be not a problem. Also, there's somehow a SIZE LIMIT (see on the hidden menu on the right) which probably is shown to users when they open a site, I remember a standard limit being 10 MB.
was it refreshing to make it look that way? ;-)
I'd call the cops, so they search them + give them an award :-)
One can't escape police violence. RIP good, old TV
I had to think of fractals, somehow when I saw this pic

Did you check if name_show shows something by now? 

The tricky part for namecoin is:
several people can make name_new in the same period, but only the "first one" wins

So, if you send your name_new 1 second later than the squatter, 
you will not notice this
until the squatter does the first_update

At least this is how I understood it. 
(The bad thing here would be, if the squatter never does a first_update. 
In theory one could like this make people waste their namecoins :-( 
Sounds a little strange, I know)
don't know how long the name_new is valid
without clicking I recognize the word duniya (in Turkish Dunya, means world). Could be an Indonesian song ? Or is it from India ?
probably the dunya comes from Arabic then, and went to many countries, even to Denmark ;-)

Yeah, when the main dev is not so active, it's not helpful. Though, @tasty and @erkanyuksel did a lot of work on the UI side. For me it just came while using Zn, what I missed on twister. Here it was just "there".
@ks do you see any error in the logs ?
for now, I put them locally here into ZN, see my comment [here](/1CiAFnnf6kb2G1GzDV1FhttTWNxCa4mShn/?Post:68:Protecting+the+opressed)

> even @erkan will not run out of space. ðŸ˜‰

wishful thinking ;-)

> And if the number goes from 00000000.txt to FFFFFFFF.txt

I remember from olden times there was some limit of amount of files in a dir. I assume that is fixed by now. If not: one could make some dirs. (or just make an archive from old posts and start fresh, by just linking in the first new post to the archive)
@ulrichard welcome :-)
This is a nice idea!

> see waves of similar emotions sweeping over the globe. 
> I would like to see such a map, wouldn't you?

oh, I am sure governments and their 3-letter agencies would also be interested in this...

I remember vaguely:
there was such kind of experiment some 5-10 years ago, over many countries

It involved that people smile or think positive or so, for some mins. Unclear.
And somehow they measured a positive wave or so
Don't ask me how they measured that
now I know I was always doing it the right way
I hope Sam can learn something from all of this, he seems to be still growing
